entry.title: “Peaceful protestors, including state Rep. Leslie Herod, spoke...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Peaceful protestors, including state Rep. Leslie Herod, spoke out against racial injustice.

“We believe in justice that we have not gotten, and as a Black woman standing in front of you, before this Captiol, we have not done our jobs in there,” Herod told the crowd.

From Kentucky to Colorado, Herod says there’s no room for racism in our country. “

...

CBS4 Local

See MoreBlack women got together to protest at the Colorado State Capitol Wednesday after learning no officers were charged in the death of Breonna Taylor.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Black Women Protest Peacefully In Denver After Announcement Of No Charges For Officers In Breonna Taylor Death

Black women got together to protest at the Colorado State Capitol Wednesday after learning no officers were charged in the death of Breonna Taylor.Black women got together to protest at the Colorado State Capitol Wednesday after learning no officers were charged in the death of Breonna Taylor.

entry.title: “COVID has been a horrible impact to our country and the...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“COVID has been a horrible impact to our country and the world. We’ve lost a lot of people,” said Scott Gilmore, deputy director of Denver Parks & Recreation. “But it’s actually also made people really appreciate their parks. It’s really made people go enjoy the parks in their communities.”

Denverite

Parks officials are trying to balance a lot of factors, including the fact that not everyone can walk or bike to nature and recreation. They’ll want to hear from you.

denverite.com

The city is taking steps to keep (some) parks (mostly) car-free long after the pandemic is gone

Parks officials are trying to balance a lot of factors, including the fact that not everyone can walk or bike to nature and recreation. They’ll want to hear from you.Parks officials are trying to balance a lot of factors, including the fact that not everyone can walk or bike to nature and recreation. They’ll want to hear from you.

entry.title: “Gatherings of any size among people between the ages of 18...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Gatherings of any size among people between the ages of 18 and 22 are prohibited in the city of Boulder until at least Oct. 8 as public health officials attempt to slow a surge in coronavirus cases linked to the University of Colorado.

An order enacting the mandate goes into effect at 4 p.m. Thursday. Violating the order is a Class 1 misdemeanor and could result in a fine of up to $5,000 and up to 18 months in jail.”

The Colorado Sun

There have been nearly 1,400 confirmed or probable coronavirus cases among University of Colorado Boulder students since Aug. 24, the first day of the school's fall semester

coloradosun.com

Boulder, seeking to stop coronavirus surge, bans all gatherings among 18 to 22 year olds until Oct. 8

There have been nearly 1,400 confirmed or probable coronavirus cases among University of Colorado Boulder students since Aug. 24, the first day of the school's fall semesterThere have been nearly 1,400 confirmed or probable coronavirus cases among University of Colorado Boulder students since Aug. 24, the first day of the school's fall semester

entry.title: “In Colorado, people are dying at the hands of law...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“In Colorado, people are dying at the hands of law enforcement,” Herod said. “In Colorado, DAs refuse to prosecute murderers. In Denver right now we have a police helicopter circling us instead of circling the murderers of Elijah McClain.”

“So we fight, and we say we don't want you in our communities to murder us.”

The Gazette

Hundreds protested in Denver Wednesday night against a grand jury's decision not to charge police officers in connection with Breonna Taylor’s death.

gazette.com

Coloradans protest no officers charged in Breonna Taylor’s death (PHOTOS)

Hundreds protested in Denver Wednesday night against a grand jury's decision not to charge police officers in connection with Breonna Taylor’s death.Hundreds protested in Denver Wednesday night against a grand jury's decision not to charge police officers in connection with Breonna Taylor’s death.

entry.title: “Police officers who kill citizens are rarely convicted. But...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Police officers who kill citizens are rarely convicted. But in this tragic situation, in which the woman killed was not only unarmed but asleep in the moments before a police officer took her life, we hoped that for once, justice would be on our side. This is yet another disappointing reminder that it’s not.”

No police officer will have to answer for Breonna Taylor’s death. This never gets easier.

nytimes.com

Opinion | It Hurts to Keep Hoping for Justice

No police officer will have to answer for Breonna Taylor’s death. This never gets easier.No police officer will have to answer for Breonna Taylor’s death. This never gets easier.

entry.content:
Representative Leslie HerodPresident Donald Trump on Wednesday would not commit to providing a peaceful transition of power after Election Day, lending further fuel to concerns he may not relinquish his office should he lose in November.

cnn.com|By Maegan Vazquez

Trump refuses to commit to a peaceful transition of power after Election Day

entry.title: “A grand jury indicted former Louisville police officer Brett...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“A grand jury indicted former Louisville police officer Brett Hankison on three counts of wanton endangerment in the first degree in connection with the fatal shooting of Breonna Taylor in March.

The charges drew immediate criticism from demonstrators who wanted more serious charges, as well as the arrests of the three officers involved.”

CNN

A grand jury indicted former Louisville police officer Brett Hankison on three counts of wanton endangerment in the first degree in connection with the fatal shooting of Breonna Taylor in March.

cnn.com

Wanton endangerment charge: What it means in the Breonna Taylor case

A grand jury indicted former Louisville police officer Brett Hankison on three counts of wanton endangerment in the first degree in connection with the fatal shooting of Breonna Taylor in March.A grand jury indicted former Louisville police officer Brett Hankison on three counts of wanton endangerment in the first degree in connection with the fatal shooting of Breonna Taylor in March.

entry.title: “What we need to do is make sure that the use of ketamine is...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“What we need to do is make sure that the use of ketamine is regulated, and that the regulation and the use is approved in a way that doesn’t end in the death of people. What we’ve seen through your investigations is that it’s not just about what’s happening in Aurora, but quite frankly, there has been instances across the state where the use of ketamine has been abused and has resulted in disastrous consequences for people, including death. We need to change that,” Herod said."

FOX31 KDVR.com

DENVER (KDVR) — The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment (CDPHE) is not revealing the status of its review of a state waiver program that allows paramedics to administer ketam…

kdvr.com

Health department stays mum on whether ketamine review has begun, one month after announcement

entry.title: “Starting this October, Denverites will have a chance to see...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Starting this October, Denverites will have a chance to see the works of Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera and other Mexican modernist artists in person. From October 25 through January 24, a new Mexican art exhibition will take over a wing of the Denver Art Museum.”

Denverite

Tickets go on sale in October.

denverite.com

entry.title: Representative Leslie HerodColorado Democratic Party was live.September 22nd is National Voter Registration Day and voting in Colorado...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie HerodColorado Democratic Party was live.

September 22nd is National Voter Registration Day and voting in Colorado starts in less than a month!

Join Biden for President, our future 2nd Gentleman DOUG EM...HOFF, singer-songwriter GRACIE ABRAMS, Colorado's Secretary of State Jena Griswold, and Representative Dylan Roberts and Representative Leslie Herod to celebrate our right to vote, learn how to make sure you're registered and ready to vote, and make sure your friends are doing the same!

The numbers are clear: when young folks show up, we make the difference!

See MoreVisit the Voting Information Center for election resources and official updates. Get Voting Information

entry.title: “Billionaire Mike Bloomberg has paid off $20million in debt...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Billionaire Mike Bloomberg has paid off $20million in debt for more than 31,000 felons in Florida so that they can vote in the state where just 537 votes decided the presidential election in 2000.”

Billionaire Mike Bloomberg has paid off $20million in debt for more than 31,000 felons in Florida so that they can vote in the state where just 537 votes decided the presidential election in 2000.

entry.title: “Colorado is facing one of the most challenging economic...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Colorado is facing one of the most challenging economic crises in our history, and public agencies are facing difficult budget constraints,” Gov. Jared Polis said in a news release. “Just as the private sector is tightening its belt, so too must the government. This thoughtful furlough plan helps address the state’s budget shortfall while ensuring that our lower wage workers are not impacted and we can continue to deliver high quality critical services for Coloradans.”

The Denver Post

Most state employees who make more than $50,000 annually will be taking up to four furlough days before the end of the fiscal year, the governor’s office announced Tuesday.

denverpost.com

Colorado governor will require furloughs for state workers – including himself

Most state employees who make more than $50,000 annually will be taking up to four furlough days before the end of the fiscal year, the governor’s office announced Tuesday.Most state employees who make more than $50,000 annually will be taking up to four furlough days before the end of the fiscal year, the governor’s office announced Tuesday.

entry.title: “These two elected prosecutors, Young a Democrat and Brauchler...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“These two elected prosecutors, Young a Democrat and Brauchler a Republican, overlooked several critical issues.

First, they failed to appreciate that they are as much of the problem as are police regarding a dearth of justice for people, mostly Black people, mistreated and sometimes wrongly killed by Aurora officers.”

Many of the recent Aurora protests focus on the dearth of credibility police and prosecutors have in “self-policing.” Aggrandized charges by these two district attorneys only fuel that controversy, further undermining their critical agencies.

sentinelcolorado.com

EDITORIAL: DAs Young and Brauchler bungle charges against Elijah McClain protesters - Sentinel Colorado

Many of the recent Aurora protests focus on the dearth of credibility police and prosecutors have in “self-policing.” Aggrandized charges by these two district attorneys only fuel that controversy, further undermining their critical agencies.Many of the recent Aurora protests focus on the dearth of credibility police and prosecutors have in “self-policing.” Aggrandized charges by these two district attorneys only fuel that controversy, further undermining their critical agencies.

entry.title: “Section 8 is the federal government’s biggest low-income...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Section 8 is the federal government’s biggest low-income housing assistance program. But an estimated three out of four people who are eligible for the housing subsidies are not served because of budget constraints. HUD acknowledges that in many parts of the country, agencies administering the program have long wait lists that can be hard to keep updated as applicants move or change phone numbers or their family circumstances change. The Denver Housing Authority moved to a lottery instead of a wait list because of the challenge of keeping a list up to date.”

Denverite

DHA and local agencies across the country administer the federal government’s biggest low-income housing assistance program

denverite.com

What’s a Section 8 housing subsidy, and what’s the need for them like in Denver?

DHA and local agencies across the country administer the federal government’s biggest low-income housing assistance programDHA and local agencies across the country administer the federal government’s biggest low-income housing assistance program

entry.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...

📸 Paul Miller Photography

Styling: LILFRESHSAM
